original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares slip in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares slipped in mid day trade on Thursday, Colombo Stock Exchange data shows.
The market is flat and slow as investors await for clear directions on the economic front, an analyst said.
All Share Price Index (ASPI) was down 0.06 percent or 5.97 points to 9,285.45, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.05 percent or 1.33 points to 2,711.76 as of 123o hours.
Top losers during mid day trade were Vallibel One, Sri Lanka Telecom and LOLC. (Colombo/April 20/2023)
